between.translation[0].definitions[0].de: in or through the space that separates two things, people, or places
between.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I sat down between Sue and Jane.
a house and stables, with a yard in between
The ball rolled between his feet.
between.translation[0].definitions[1].de: in the time that separates two times or events
between.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Are there any public holidays between Christmas and Easter?
The team have a lot of work to do between now and Sunday.
A lot of students spend a year abroad in between school and university.
I’ve had a few jobs, with long periods of unemployment in between.
between.translation[0].definitions[2].de: within a range of amounts, numbers, distances etc
between.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The project will cost between eight and ten million dollars.
Most of the victims were young men between the ages of 16 and 21.
between.translation[0].definitions[3].de: used to say which two places are joined or connected by something
between.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: They’re building a new road between Manchester and Sheffield.
between.translation[0].definitions[4].de: used to say which people or things are involved in something together or are connected
between.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: the long-standing friendship between Bob and Bryan
She had overheard a private conversation between two MPs.
the link between serious sunburn and deadly skin cancer
between.translation[0].definitions[5].de: used to say which people or things get, have, or are involved in something that is shared
between.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: Tom divided his money between his children.
Between the four of them they managed to lift her into the ambulance.
between.translation[0].definitions[6].de: used to say which two things or people you are comparing
between.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: the contrast between town and country life
In her book she makes a comparison between Russian and British ballet.
the difference between good music and really great music
between.translation[0].definitions[7].de: used when it is difficult to give an exact description of something and you therefore have to compare it to two things that are similar to it
between.translation[0].definitions[7].ex: He uttered a sound that was something between a sigh and a groan.
